title: Translate Verb Tenses
instruction: Translate these sentences from classical Buddhist texts. Pay attention to the verb stem to determine the tense.

questions.transliteration: spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis phung po lnga stong par bltas
questions.correctAnswer: Noble Avalokiteshvara saw the five aggregates as empty.

questions.transliteration: dge ba thams cad byang chub tu bsngo
questions.correctAnswer: I shall dedicate all virtue toward enlightenment.

breakdown.verb: བསྔོ (shall dedicate — future stem of སྔོ)

correctFeedback: Excellent! You correctly identified the verb tenses from their stems.
incorrectFeedback: Review the verb stems: past བལྟས (saw), future བསྔོ (shall dedicate), imperative ལྟོས (look!).
